text: is how I did this is what worked well this is what didn't work well this is what the market did so that I have a log of what works when then I also have kind of this section for audits this is kind of important to include because I believe it is really wise for Traders to embrace external audits have other people look at your and give you feedback if they start reading through your trading plan and they're like hey well what do you do in this scenario that tells you that you're not defining that quite well enough and you probably should think through it because if there's too much variability in Your Capacity to deploy there's a good chance that you are going going to pick route a sometimes route b sometimes and then you're not going to understand what works best over the long run now let's take a look at the trading log very quickly and then a couple last things beyond that the trading log for me is super simple I use Excel you can use Google Sheets you can automate some of it if you're so inclined I do but I really am an advocate of the process of inputting the trades the reason why I'm an advocate for that is it gets you closer to the data as compared to just porting things over via an API or something like that now I have the first tab is just kind

text: difficult to combine all of that into one tab so each strategy has its own Tab and that's it so all of the individual strategy tabs then feed into the portfolio summary and then I have another section where I run different studies maybe you're curious how a 50-day crossover works works and you start back testing it well don't just do that and not track what you're doing because then that data is only as efficacious as your memory is don't do that what you should do is consider something like this like this where you track the results of your study now you have a reference point it might not be perfect it might not be the best study on planet Earth but it gives you something again when we're going through this trading log it gives us an opportunity to validate strategy performance we get to see how our portfolio is behaving and then we get to test our hypothesis and quantify the outcome because lots of people have very Rosy Recollections about how good things went when really they might not have gone that well so it forces us to reconcile that so those are trading plans strategy outlines trading logs I talk about these all the time because they are absolutely pivotal it is work but it's something that evolves over time so you don't have to get stuck in the mud early on start simple and build on it if you have any questions
